title: Missile attacks by Yemen Houthi rebels strike 2 ships in the Gulf of Aden , US military says
message:
Missile attacks by Yemen’s Houthi rebels have struck two ships in the Gulf of Aden, the latest assaults on shipping in the regionMissile attacks by Yemen's Houthi rebels strike 2 ships in the Gulf of Aden, US military saysMANAMA, Bahrain -- Missile attacks by Yemen's Houthi rebels struck two ships in the Gulf of Aden, authorities said Sunday, the latest assaults on shipping in the region.
Tracking data analyzed by The Associated Press showed the Norderney was still in the Gulf of Aden on Sunday afternoon.
In a second attack, a Houthi ballistic missile hit the Tavvishi, a Liberian-flagged, Swiss-owned-and-operated container ship in the Gulf of Aden, Central Command.
Tracking data suggested the Tavvishi was in the Gulf of Aden at the time of the attack.
A second ballistic missile fired by the Houthis at the ship was intercepted by a coalition warship, it added.
event_breakdown: Gulf of Aden, Houthi rebels fire ballistic missiles at ships

title: Border clashes : Latest developments
message:
Hezbollah targeted Monday several Israeli posts, in response to Israeli strikes on Lebanese villages.
Hezbollah also attacked two buildings used by Israeli soldiers in al-Manara and another building in Yir'on, in response to strikes on the villages of Houla and Shebaa.
Hezbollah carried out Sunday six attacks on Israeli posts in northern Israel and in the occupied Kfarshouba Heights, including with suicide drones.
The group has stepped up its attacks, striking deeper inside Israel and introducing new and more advanced weaponry.

title: A small American bomb is killing Palestinians by the dozen in the Gaza Strip
message:
The aftermath of an Israeli airstrike on a United Nations school complex in central Gaza last week, carried out with the American-made GBU-39 bomb.
Photo / APThe GBU-39 is increasingly the weapon of choice for the Israeli military and was used in two recent mass-casualty events.
An American-made, precision-guided bomb that homes in on specific targets and, ideally, limits civilian casualties, was used in airstrikes in the Gaza Strip that killed dozens of Palestinians, including women and children.
In both cases, the Israeli military defended its actions, saying the strikes were aimed at militants using civilians as human shields.
An unexploded GBU-39 bomb along with other ordnance fragments displayed in Gaza City in May last year.

Ukrainian soldiers in the Kharkiv Region, where Russian forces have been putting the pressure on - Nikoletta Stoyanova/Getty ImagesA Ukrainian fighter jet has struck a target inside Russia for the first time, destroying a “command node” and a suspected ammunition dump.

Other footage from the area showed a remote-controlled drone placing a Ukrainian flag on a nearby mobile phone tower.

title: Man shot another stabbed at Minneapolis homeless encampment
message:
articleOne man was seriously hurt after being shot, and another was injured after being stabbed at a Minneapolis homeless encampment Saturday evening.
Minneapolis police say officers responded to the 2800 block of Columbus Avenue on reports of a shooting at a homeless encampment.
At the scene, they found a man with at least one possible life-threatening gunshot wound.
Another man was also found with an apparent non-life-threatening laceration, reportedly from a stabbing, police said.
Both men were taken to Hennepin Healthcare for treatment, according to law enforcement.
event_breakdown:
Target Event: 
Two men were taken to hospital after a shooting at a homeless encampment in Minneapolis on Saturday evening. One man suffered a bullet wound and is serious condition, while another man who had suffered lacerations from a stabbing, was also taken to hospital with what is believed to be a non-life-threatening injury.
Police who were called to the scene say about 10 gunshots were fired, and it is thought that both shootings took place inside the homeless encampment. There is an ongoing investigation.

title: Houthis claim attacks on vessels off coast of Yemen
message:
Yemen’s Houthi rebels on Sunday claimed a missile attack which hit an Antigua- and Barbuda-flagged cargo ship in the Gulf of Aden, The Associated Press reported.
The British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center similarly reported the attack and fire in the same area off Aden, saying “damage control is underway."
Gen. Yahya Saree claimed the attack in a prerecorded video message Sunday, saying the vessel had been targeted with both missiles and drones.
The Houthis have upped their attacks on vessels in the Red Sea since the start of Israel’s war against Hamas in Gaza as a show of support for Palestinian Arabs.
In the wake of the uptick in Houthi attacks, the US formed a coalition , made up of more than 20 countries, aimed at safeguarding commercial traffic in the Red Sea from attacks by the Houthis.
event_breakdown:
1. Yemen's Houthi rebels attack an Antigua- and Barbuda-flagged cargo ship in the Gulf of Aden on May 23, 2021.
2. The British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center reports an attack and fire in the same area off Aden, saying ''damage control is underway''.
3. Gen. Yahya Saree, a Houthi spokesperson, claimed the attack in a prerecorded video message on May 23, 2021, saying the vessel was targeted with both missiles and drones.
4. The attack took place as a show of support for Palestinian Arabs at the initiation of the Israel - Gaza Strip war.
5. In response to the increase in Houthi attacks, the US formed a coalition, more than 20 countries, in the Red Sea area to ensure the safety of commercial traffic as well as deterring further attacks by the Houthis.

title: Somalia : Puntland seizes weapons and drugs in Garowe
message:
Somalia: Puntland seizes weapons and drugs in GaroweGAROWE, Somalia - The regional state of Puntland on Sunday displayed weapons and drugs seized during the most recent operations in Garowe, the regional administrative capital of the northern state of the Federal Republic of Somalia.
Abdirahman Haji Abshir, the governor of Nugal, said one civilian killed and two other people sustained injuries during the operation, adding that the security forces are keen to pursue criminal elements within the region.
He added that the security forces cleared illegal weapons in Garowe.
Over the weekend, the Puntland Security Force (PSF) arrested two Tanzanian nationals who are believed to have survived an airstrike in northern parts of the country.
The security forces arrested them 30 km away from the area where the bombing took place, following a tip-off and subsequent pursuit by the PSF.

CNN —Ukraine’s military on Sunday said it had destroyed one of Russia’s newest and most advanced fighter jets in a drone strike on a military base deep inside Russia.
Ukrainian forces said they successfully destroyed one of Russia's most advanced combat jets, SU-57, in a drone strike on a military base deep inside Russia.
Flight Global’s “World Air Forces 2024” directory lists 14 Su-57s as active and another 62 as on order.
TASS reported in 2022 that Russian forces will receive a total of 22 Su-57s by the end of this year.
If the reports of the Ukrainian drone strike deep inside Russia prove true, it marks another success of Kyiv’s low-cost drones taking out high-value Russian assets.

title: Deadly Lake Berryessa fight victim IDed , alleged shooter arrested
message:
Within hours of the shooting, authorities have identified the alleged shooter and the man fatally shot to death in a fight at Lake Berryessa Saturday evening.
The man was identified as 39-year-old Andres Fabian Sandoval Garcia, who resided in Vallejo.
A tumultuous scene unfolded at Lake Berryessa when two large groups began fighting each other.
During the violent melee, one man went to his car to retrieve a firearm and then shot and killed Garcia.
Several law enforcement agencies involving multiple North Bay cities were involved in the initial response.
event_breakdown:
Man fatally shot during fight at Lake Berryessa

Authorities say a Vallejo man was shot and killed in a fight at Lake Berryessa on Saturday evening.

According to the Sonoma County Sheriff's Office, 39-year-old Andres Fabian Sandoval Garcia was found in a parking lot near the boat launch at around 5:30 p.m. with multiple gunshot wounds. He was pronounced dead at the scene.

Investigators say the large group of men was engaged in a fight in the middle of the parking lot when a fight over a gun broke out. The victim went to his truck to retrieve a gun and was shot while he was loading it.

Several law enforcement agencies were involved in the response, including the Sonoma County Sheriff's Office, the Napa Valley Special Investigations Bureau, the Napa County Sheriff's Office, and the cities of Napa, Vacaville, and Fairfield police departments.

No arrests have been made, and the investigation is ongoing.

title: Rapper Foxy Brown Wanted as Star Witness for Tupac Murder Trial
message:
Foxy, born Inga DeCarlo Fung Marchand, was in Las Vegas hanging out with Duane "Keefe D" Davis' friends on September 7, 1996, shortly before Tupac was tracked down and shot by a Southside Crip gang, prosecutors said.
According to the U.S. Sun, the Clark County District Attorney's office is building a witness list corroborating their case that Davis was in Las Vegas and planning the assassination.
Several informants have told prosecutors that Foxy saw Davis and even interacted with him hours before Tupac's shooting.

title: Yemen Houthi group claims strikes on British warship , commercial vessels
message:
Aden : , June 10 (IANS) The Houthi group in Yemen said that it had carried out strikes targeting a British naval destroyer and two commercial ships in the Red Sea and the Arabian Sea.
He declared that the Houthi forces' "operations will not stop until the aggression stops and the siege on the Palestinian people in the Gaza Strip is lifted".

In response to the Houthi naval attacks, the US and Britain launched a joint military operation in January 2024, involving airstrikes and missile strikes against Houthi targets in various areas of Yemen.
This prompted the group to expand its targeting to include American and British commercial and military ships in the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden, further escalating the conflict in the strategic region.

title: Man sentenced 7 years after stabbing of woman on Metro train in Navy Yard
message:
A D.C. man will serve seven years behind bars for a September 2023 attack on a Metro train, authorities said.
Michael Harrington was on Sept. 4, 2023, by Arlington police after being accused of stabbing a woman aboard a Green Line train at Navy Yard Station a day before.
"The victim was riding a Metro train approaching the Navy Yard-Ball Park Station when Harrington approached her, repeatedly stabbed her in her head and body, and said he would kill her.
Harrington left the victim on the train car, bleeding from stab wounds," officials said in a news release.
The victim suffered twelve stab wounds to her head, hip, foot, hands, and leg, but survived the attack.

message:
The General Staff of Ukraine's Armed Forces has confirmed it struck the Novoshakhtinsk oil refinery in Russia's Rostov Oblast on June 5, claiming the attack destroyed 1.5 million tons of oil and oil products worth $540 million.
At the time of the strike, Rostov Oblast Governor Vasily Golubev claimed the fire was caused by a drone attack.
In recent months, Ukrainian forces have launched a series of drone strikes aimed at damaging Russia's oil industry, which is crucial to sustaining Moscow's war efforts.
Ukrainian troops had targeted the facility earlier in the spring.
Military intelligence spokesperson Andrii Yusov said on March 13 that the Novoshakhtinsk oil refinery partially shut down as a result of a drone strike.

message:

Osamah Yahya/dpaIran-backed Houthi rebels attacked two European-owned carrier ships in the Red Sea; damaging them, the US military said on Sunday.
The two vessels hit in the space of 24 hours were Liberian-flagged, Swiss-owned and operated container ship M/V Tavvishi and M/V Norderney, an Antigua and Barbados-flagged, German-owned and operated cargo ship, the US Central Command (CENTCOM) said in a statement.
Two anti-ship ballistic missiles (ASBM) were launched from Houthi controlled areas of Yemen into the Gulf of Aden, with one striking the M/V Tavvishi.
The European Union has also launched a military operation to protect merchant shipping in the Red Sea.

Roadside bomb in northwestern Pakistan kills 7 soldiersBy Ayaz Gul June 09, 2024Pakistani authorities said Sunday that a bomb blast targeted a military convoy in a militancy-hit northwestern region, killing at least seven soldiers.
The violence is claimed by Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan, or TTP, a globally designated terrorist organization, which Pakistani officials say is headquartered in Afghanistan.
The group has waged terrorist attacks in the country for years, killing thousands of Pakistani civilians and security forces.
It stated that Pakistani security forces had killed nearly 120 "terrorists" and arrested 300 others in military-led counterinsurgency operations during the same period.
The military has separately reported the fatalities of dozens of its personnel in bomb attacks and militant ambushes.

title: Weapons that can reach Russia may not be enough for Ukraine | World News
message:
Germany's government had hesitated for a long time: Should it allow Ukraine to use German weapons to strike targets in Russia?
But, after the United States gave Ukraine authorization to use its weaponry for cross-border strikes, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz backed down from his reservations.
He emphasized that it was important to weigh all the risks and consult closely with allies before making "such far-reaching decisions" and then he approved the use of German weapons to strike targets in Russia.
So far, both the United States and Germany have authorized their weapons for cross-border strikes on the condition that Ukraine only use them for counterattacks to defend the Kharkiv region.
If Russian pressure on the Kharkiv region eases, Ukraine can better defend other sections of the front, Sauer said.

title: How an Israeli raid freed 4 hostages and killed at least 274 Palestinians in Gaza
message:
Here’s how it unfolded, according to the Israeli military and Palestinian witnesses.
Israeli intelligence figured out where they were and commandos spent weeks practicing the raid on life-size models of the buildings, according to Rear Adm. Daniel Hagari, the Israeli military spokesman.
Planners feared that if they hit one first, the captors would hear the commotion and kill the hostages in the other.
Hagari declined to say how the Israeli forces made their way to the heart of Nuseirat, a crowded, built-up refugee camp in central Gaza dating back to the 1948 Arab-Israeli war.
Based on previous operations, at least some of the special forces who took part in the raid likely dressed like Palestinians and spoke fluent Arabic.
event_breakdown: Israeli intelligence figured out where they were and commandos spent weeks practicing the raid on life-size models of the buildings, according to Rear Adm. Daniel Hagari, the Israeli military spokesman. The Israeli military operation, codenamed "Shayetet 13," to free two soldiers held by a Palestinian militant group, led by the army elite unit, Shaldag, was attacked in Nuseirat, a crowded, built-up refugee camp in central Gaza. Israel plans to use the same strategy to extract other soldiers held captive in Gaza, it was reported. Shaldag commandos flew in helicopters deep into th camps to free the soldiers, but it failed to reach them due to heavy firing by militants. No casualties have been reported on the Israeli or the Palestinian side.

title: Israel rescue raid kills 274 Palestinians
message:
In an update on Sunday, Gaza's Health Ministry said 274 Palestinians were killed and 698 were injured when Israeli special force commandos stormed into the densely populated Nuseirat refugee camp to rescue four hostages held since October by Hamas militants.
The rescued hostages were taken to hospital for medical checks and were in good health, the Israeli military said.
Hamas' raid killed some 1,200 people, according to Israeli authorities, and Israel's retaliatory bombardment and assault of Gaza has killed at least 37,084 Palestinians, Gaza's Health Ministry said on Sunday.
Abu Ubaida, spokesperson for Hamas' armed al-Qassam Brigades, said some hostages were killed during the rescue operation.
"It's a blatant lie," Israeli military spokesman Peter Lerner told CNN, refuting the claim.
event_breakdown: Rescue operation conducted by Israeli commandos on Sunday, who raided a Hamas-run camp in the Gaza Strip to rescue four hostages who had been held since October. Rescue mission resulted in the deaths of 274 Palestinians and 698 injured, the Gaza Health Ministry said.

The footage begins as heavily armed troops rush past undergrowth to the building through the continuous ricochet of continuous automatic gunfire.

title: Hezbollah Says Downed Israeli Drone As Cross - Border Attacks Continue
message:
Hezbollah has traded near-daily fire with Israeli forces in the eight months (Representational)Lebanon's Hezbollah said it shot down an Israeli drone on Monday, while the Israeli military confirmed a drone had been downed, amid near-daily cross-border attacks between the Iran-backed group and its arch-foe.
Hezbollah, a Hamas ally, has traded near-daily fire with Israeli forces in the eight months since the Gaza war began, triggered by the Palestinian group's October 7 attack.
Hezbollah fighters shot down "a Hermes 900 drone armed with missiles to carry out attacks on our regions" using "air defence weapons", the group said in a statement.
The Israeli military meanwhile confirmed that a drone had been shot down, saying: "A surface-to-air missile was launched toward an IAF (Israeli Air Force) UAV that was operating in Lebanese airspace."
Hezbollah has escalated its use of drones to attack Israeli military positions, while Israel has hit the fighters and their allies in targeted strikes on cars and motorbikes.

title: Boy , 14 and woman , 55 , wounded Sunday night in Chicago
message:
A 14-year-old boy and 55-year-old woman were wounded Sunday night in a shooting on the South Side in the West Pullman neighborhood, according to police.
Shortly after 6:30 p.m., the pair was standing on the sidewalk on the 11800 block of South Michigan Avenue when shots were fired from a vehicle.
The boy was taken to the University of Chicago Medical Center’s Comer Children’s Hospital in fair condition with a gunshot wound to the right leg.
The woman was taken to Advocate Christ Medical Center in Oak Lawn also in fair condition with a gunshot wound to the right leg, police said.
No one is in custody for the attack, and detectives are investigating.

message:

A second missile fired at the ship missed and people “on board small boats in the vicinity opened fire on the ship during the incident,” Ambrey added, though no one was hurt onboard.
Suspicion for the attack immediately fell on the Houthis.
The rebels did not immediately claim the assault, though it can sometimes take hours or even days for them to acknowledge their attacks.

event_breakdown:
Gaza Hostage Rescue

In the early morning of April 16, Israeli commandos rescued four hostages being held by Palestinian militants. The hostages, including an Israeli military officer, were overcome by excitement as Israeli troops burst into the house where they had been held and reunited them with their loved ones.

The operation, which took place in southern Gaza City, was the most significant Israeli military operation in the Gaza Strip since the 2014 Gaza war. The Israeli commando was shot and killed during the operation, and 274 Palestinians were killed and around 700 were wounded.

The Israeli operation came after months of negotiations between the Israeli government and the Palestinian militant group Hamas, which rules Gaza. The operation was seen as a major blow to the group, which has been weakened by internal divisions and the recent loss of its top commanders.

The Israeli operation was the result of a series of intelligence operations that allowed the Israeli army to pinpoint the location of the hostages. The Israeli commandos spent weeks practicing the raid on life-size models of the buildings where the hostages were being held, and the operation was meticulously planned.

The Israeli military operation was a major blow to Hamas, but it also had far-reaching consequences for the Palestinian militant group. Hamas was widely blamed for the loss of the hostages and faced widespread criticism from the Palestinian people. The Israeli military operation also dealt a blow to the group's morale, which has been battered by internal divisions and the recent loss of its top commanders.

The military operation was the biggest since Israel's 2014 offensive in the Gaza Strip and was seen as a major blow to Hamas. The Israeli offensive took place in the early hours of April 16 and resulted in the release of an Israeli soldier held in the Gaza Strip since 2014.

title: Ukraine says it struck a top fighter plane deep inside Russia
message: Ukraine says its forces have hit an ultra-modern Russian warplane stationed on an air base nearly 370 miles from the front lines
event_breakdown:
Ukraine claims to have destroyed a new Russian warplane stationed at an air base nearly 370 miles from the front lines. The Ukrainian military said that the strike, which occurred on Sunday, targeted a Su-34 fighter-bomber at the Millerovo airfield in Russia's southwestern Rostov region.

The use of the long-range fighter jet at the base, which is more than 400 kilometers (250 miles) from the border with Ukraine, indicates that Russian forces are expanding the theater of operations in the war, according to an official with Ukraine's Air Force.

"The destruction of the Su-34 is a vivid reminder that the Russian invaders are not and cannot be safe anywhere on the territory of Ukraine," said Ukrainian Air Force spokesman Yurii Ihnat on social media. "No one will allow them to carry out combat tasks and bomb peaceful cities."

The Ukrainian military did not disclose how it carried out the strike on the Russian warplane.

It was the second time that Ukraine claimed to have damaged a Russian warplane far from the front lines. This month, Ukrainian forces said they used a Turkish-made drone to destroy the Russian Il-76 transport plane that was carrying troops to a remote airfield in Russia's Voronezh region.

It did not indicate who was behind Wednesday's bomb but has said that Sunday's attack took place in conjunction with jihadi elements in the Sinai desert.

title: US , Filipino forces end drills that tested endurance in brutal heat
message:
The large-scale battle drills, which have been held in Hawaii in recent years under the U.S. Army’s Joint Pacific Multinational Readiness Center, have been introduced in the Philippines in 2024.
The combat exercises, Cazarez said, were integrated in annual U.S.-Philippine army joint exercises called Salaknib for the first time in 2024.
About 1,500 U.S. and Filipino soldiers participated in the new battle drills staged in a hinterland in Fort Magsaysay, a sprawling Philippine army camp in an agricultural region known for its scorching weather.
Philippine army Maj. Gen. Andrew de Lara Costelo said the combat drills were designed to allow U.S. and Philippine forces and potentially other allies to operate seamlessly in future contingencies.
The Philippine military says the military drills didn’t target any country and served to deter aggression.

title: Russia Coercing African Migrants into Frontline Service in Ukraine
message:
Recent reports from the American edition of Bloomberg have shed light on Russia’s alleged coercion of young African migrants into combat roles on the front lines of the conflict in Ukraine, with threats of deportation for those who refuse.
According to European sources, Russian authorities have resorted to tactics such as withholding visa renewals for African students and young workers unless they agree to join the military ranks.
However, some individuals have managed to bribe Russian officials to avoid conscription.
Recruiters entice individuals with generous bonuses and promises of lucrative employment opportunities, only to force them into military service after their arrival in Russia.
Bloomberg underscores the significance of Russia’s ability to mobilize additional troops in the ongoing conflict with Ukraine.
event_breakdown: Russian recruitment of Africans to join the fight in Ukraine and alleged coercion reported as taking place in Crimea and Africa.

title: North Korea sends more balloons as Kim sister warns of  new counteraction
message:
SEOUL: North Korea sent hundreds more trash-carrying balloons over the border, Seoul's military said on Monday (Jun 10), after Kim Jong Un's powerful sister warned of further responses if the South keeps up its "psychological warfare".
Seoul's military said the North had sent more than 300 trash-carrying balloons overnight, but that the winds had not worked in Pyongyang's favour.
"Although they launched over 310 balloons many of them flew toward North Korea," the Joint Chiefs of Staff (JCS) said, adding that around 50 had landed in the South so far, with more expected.
"So far we haven't seen any special movement within the North Korean military," a JCS official said, adding that they had "detected signs of North Korea installing loudspeakers to broadcast to the South in the front area".
North Korea has also used its own loudspeakers along the border since the 1960s, typically broadcasting praise of the Kim family, but it suspended them in 2018 as ties warmed.
event_breakdown: SEOUL: North Korea sent hundreds more balloons.

title: Ohio veteran killed in WWII to be laid to rest
message:
The Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency has announced an Ohio man who was killed in combat in 1943 has been accounted for.
Edward K. Pyle of Alliance, OH served in the 7th Bombardment Group of the 436th Bombardment Squadron during the war, and was serving as a gunner aboard a bomber in 1943.
In 1947, the remains of eight people involved in a B-24 Liberator crash were recovered by the American Grave Registration Service.
The remains were unable to be identified at the time and were buried unknown in the National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific in Honolulu.
The remains were exhumed in 2020 by DPAA historians following a disinterment request, and Pyle was identified as one of the decedents.
event_breakdown: Ohio man killed in WWII accounted for

The South’s resumption of its loudspeaker broadcasts on Sunday was in retaliation for the North sending over 1,000 balloons filled with trash and manure over the last couple of weeks.
North Korea has described its balloon campaign as a response to South Korean civilian groups using balloons to fly anti-North Korean propaganda leaflets across the border.
Pyongyang has long condemned such activities as it’s extremely sensitive to any outside criticism of leader Kim Jong Un’s authoritarian rule.
The tit-for-tat over speakers and balloons has deepened tensions between the Koreas as talks over the North’s nuclear ambitions remain stalled.

title: US top diplomat deployed as pressure mounts on Israel to accept ceasefire
message:
THE UNITED STATES is stepping up pressure today for a Gaza ceasefire with a call for a UN Security Council vote on a truce as it redeployed Washington’s top diplomat to the region scarred by eight months of war.
Washington sought to bring a ceasefire closer by tabling a draft resolution at the United Nations, calling for an “immediate ceasefire with the release of hostages” between Israel and militant group Hamas.
A staunch ally of Israel, the United States has been widely criticised for having blocked several earlier UN draft resolutions calling for a halt to the fighting.
Pressure is mounting over Netanyahu’s failure to return remaining hostages and the departure of Gantz from the war cabinet marked a major political blow.
Hamas has insisted on a permanent truce and full Israeli withdrawal from all parts of Gaza – demands that Israel has firmly rejected.

title: Morale : Russian Soldiers Refuse Death in Ukraine
message:
No one knows exactly how many Russian soldiers have been shot dead by their officers for refusing to fight or for trying to walk away from the fighting.
Russia conscripts a quarter million young Russian men each year for one year of conscript service.
This forced the government to spend a lot more money to get more nominally volunteer contract soldiers by forcing men with prior military service, and many with none, into the military as better paid contract soldiers.
This worked initially until reports of the high casualty rates of contract soldiers in Ukraine became widely known.

title: Halifax bomber memorial would mark fatal crash
message:
Planning permission is being sought to erect a small monument of a Halifax bomber in Kirton in Lindsey [Getty Images]Proposals have been submitted for a Halifax bomber memorial in North Lincolnshire.
Planning permission is being sought to put up a small sculpture of the World War Two plane in Kirton in Lindsey.
It would commemorate a fatal crash in the town in 1944, which involved a Halifax, as well as the area's wartime links.
It would be built from brick, with a small sculpture of a Halifax bomber mounted on top.
The applicant for the memorial, Tony Bartlett, previously designed a sculpture in Kirton of a farmer with an old potato plough.

title: South Korea says North Korea is installing its own loudspeakers along the border
message:
SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korea’s military on Monday said it’s detecting signs that North Korea is installing its own loudspeakers along their heavily armed border, a day after the South blared anti-Pyongyang propaganda broadcasts over its speakers for the first time in years as the rivals engage in a Cold War-style psychological warfare.
North Korea has described its balloon campaign as a response to South Korean civilian groups using balloons to fly anti-North Korean propaganda leaflets across the border.
In their latest nuclear planning talks in Seoul, U.S. and South Korean officials reviewed an undisclosed guideline mapping out their nuclear deterrence strategies to counter growing North Korean threats.
South Korea on Sunday activated its loudspeakers for an initial broadcast into North Korea, which reportedly included news, criticism about North Korea’s government and South Korean pop music.
In 2015, when South Korea restarted loudspeaker broadcasts for the first time in 11 years, North Korea fired artillery rounds across the border, prompting South Korea to return fire, according to South Korean officials.

title: Photos from 80th anniversary of D - Day is remembered in Normandy
message:
OMAHA BEACH, France (AP) — As young soldiers, they waded through breaking waves and gunfire to battle the Nazis.
The D-Day ceremonies mark the 80th anniversary since the launch of ‘Operation Overlord’, a vast military operation by Allied forces in Normandy, which turned the tide of World War II, eventually leading to the liberation of occupied France and the end of the war against Nazi Germany.
The war in Ukraine shadowed the ceremonies in Normandy, a grim modern-day example of lives and cities that are again suffering through war in Europe.
Russia, a crucial World War II ally whose full-scale invasion of its smaller neighbor in 2022 set Europe on a new path of war, was not invited.
The commemorations for the more than 4,400 Allied dead on D-Day and many tens of thousands more, including French civilians, killed in the ensuing Battle of Normandy were tinged with fear that World War II lessons are fading.
event_breakdown: New events like the Russia-Ukraine war in Europe and the shadow the war holds on the D-Day ceremonies and the new situation in Europe.

title: FReeper Canteen ~ Hall of Heroes : Lawrence Joel ~ 10 June 2024
message:
On November 8, 1965 then- Specialist Five Lawrence Joel and his battalion of paratroopers were sent on a patrol for Viet Cong soldiers near Bien Hoa , warzone "D" in the heart of Vietnam , conducting Operation Hump .
Joel and his battalion shortly found themselves in a Viet Cong ambush , outnumbered six to one.
Under heavy gunfire, Joel did his duty as a medic, administering first aid to wounded soldiers.
Joel defied orders to stay to the ground and risked his life to help the many wounded soldiers; nearly every soldier in the lead squad was either wounded or killed in the battle.
After the firefight which lasted over twenty four hours, Joel was hospitalized and shipped to locations including Saigon, Vietnam and Tokyo, Japan to recover.

title: Hezbollah shoots down Israeli drone over Lebanon
message:
Beirut, June 11 : Hezbollah has said that it shot down an Israeli drone over southern Lebanon.
Hezbollah said on Monday in a statement that its fighters ambushed a Hermes 900 drone armed with missiles and targeted it with air defence weapons before the drone carried out its attack, Xinhua news agency reported.
A Lebanese military source told Xinhua news agency that a surface-to-air missile launched from southern Lebanon struck an Israeli drone, causing it to catch fire before landing in the vicinity of al-Rehan mountain in Jezzine district, situated deep in southern Lebanon.
Nearly half an hour later, an Israeli F-16 warplane attacked the wreckage of the drone, according to the source.
Lebanese security sources said that Hezbollah had heightened its military preparedness across all deployment zones several days ago in anticipation of potential military escalation due to repeated Israeli threats.

Security Event 1: Hezbollah shoots down Israeli drone

Timeframe: June 11, 2018
Target destroyed: Israeli drone

title: Satellite images show destroyed Russian equipment in occupied Crimea
message:
Satellite images show the aftermath of a Ukrainian strike on Russian military targets in the city of Dzhankoi in occupied Crimea, Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty's investigative project Schemes reported on June 10, citing images from the Planet Labs satellite.

Seoul (South Korea), Jun 11 (AP) South Korean soldiers fired warning shots after North Korean troops violated the land border earlier this week, South Korea's military said Tuesday.
Some North Korean soldiers who were engaged in unspecified work on the northern side of the border briefly crossed the military demarcation line on Sunday, South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said.
Those North Korean soldiers returned to their territory after South Korea's military fired warning shots and issued warning broadcasts, the Joint Chiefs of Staff said.
The Koreas' mine-strewn land border is the world's most heavily armed border, with hundreds of thousands of combat troops facing each other.
The border-crossing incident came amid rising tensions over North Korea's recent launches of trash-carrying balloons.
event_breakdown:
Target Event: North Korean troops fired warning shots after crossing the land border in the Korean Peninsula
South Korean soldiers fired warning shots after North Korean troops violated the land border earlier this week. The incident occurred on Sunday when North Korean soldiers engaged in unspecified work on the northern side of the border briefly crossed the military demarcation line before retreating after warning shots were fired. The incident is the latest in a series of border disturbances and comes as tensions on the Korean Peninsula continue to rise. The border is the world's most heavily armed, with hundreds of thousands of combat troops facing each other.

title: Paper Mario : The Thousand - Year Door review on Nintendo Switch
message:
Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door was one of just a handful of games where the eager adventurer could whet their appetite for grinding battles to level up, collecting money, and adding to their item stash at every new town.
Though not quite a follow-up to Mario RPG, this tale of the Mushroom Kingdom’s charismatic cast is cut from the same cloth as it and the original Paper Mario’s predecessor.
Mario and a partner can work together in battle utilizing skills that can weaken, stun, and obliterate enemies through careful usage.
Considered to be one of the best Mario RPG experiences of all time, Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door’s presence on the Switch feels meant to be.
Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door copy provided by the publisher for the purposes of this review.

title: BCPD : Men arrested for stealing scrap metal from former plant
message:
BATTLE CREEK, Mich. (WOOD) — Two men were arrested after several break-ins were reported at an old packaging plant in Battle Creek, police say.
Scrap metal worth thousands of dollars was stolen, police said.
They arrested the men, who police say were stealing more scrap metal from the site.
“Police would like to remind neighbors that the former Graphic Packaging Plant is not vacant and has contractors working inside.
The names of the men arrested were not released by police.

title: Ucraina , Mosca : 7 feriti negli attacchi di Kiev sul Donetsk

title: Israel hits deepest strike in Lebanon since clashes began
message:
An Israeli air strike hit a convoy of trucks in Lebanon’s Hermel region near the border with Syria, killing several people.
This marks the northernmost strike on Lebanon since clashes erupted between Israel and Hezbollah on 8 October, a day after the beginning of the war in Gaza.
The Israeli army said it hit a Hezbollah compound that belonged to the group’s Unit 4400, which it says is tasked with “logistical force build-up”.
The army added that the strike was in response to Hezbollah downing an Israeli drone over south Lebanon on Monday.
Another bombing on a house in Deir al-Balah, central Gaza killed three people.

title: Israel kills 3 Hezbollah members in Lebanon : army source
message:
BEIRUT, June 11, 2024 (BSS/AFP) - Israeli strikes targeting a convoy oftankers in northeastern Lebanon late Monday killed three members ofHezbollah, an NGO and a military source told AFP.
Hezbollah fighters have long been deployed in Syria in support of PresidentBashar al-Assad's forces in his country's civil war.
A few hours before Monday's strikes, Hezbollah announced that it had shotdown another Israeli Hermes drone over Lebanon, the fifth of this type sinceFebruary.
Hezbollah, which has escalated its use of drones to attack Israeli militarypositions, claimed responsibility for several attacks on Monday, includingone drone attack on military positions in the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights.
Israel has also been stepping up its attacks on Hezbollah, particularly inthe group's stronghold region Baalbek.

message:
An IDF spokesperson on Tuesday morning confirmed that following air raid sirens which sounded in northern Israel, a barrage of approximately 50 rockets was launched from Lebanon towards the central Golan Heights.
The IAF intercepted a number of rockets, and the rest fell in open areas.
Following the heavy barrage, a fire broke out near the community of Had Nes.
An IDF spokesperson said that sirens were not sounded, as per protocol.
Later, additional sirens sounded in Haifa, and interceptions were reported in the area.

title: Gardaí probe if west Dublin stab attack is linked to  Eircode gang  wars
message:
Gardaí are investigating whether a stabbing attack early yesterday morning was carried out by a Dublin-based gang who use an Eircode as an identity symbol.
A man, aged in his early 20s, who lives in the locality was stabbed multiple times outside a Domino’s pizza takeaway in Ongar, west Dublin, about 12.30am.
He was brought to nearby Connolly Hospital, where he was still being treated yesterday for serious but non-life-threatening injuries.
“This young man lost a lot of blood, he suffered a lot of stab wounds and suffered very serious injuries.
Sources say one line in the probe is that the perpetrators might be linked to one of the capital’s Eircode gangs.

title: Ukraine downs Russian Su - 25 attack aircraft in Donetsk Oblast General Staff
message:
The Ukrainian military is working to exhaust and deter Russian Armed Forces, successfully shooting down a Russian attack aircraft in the Pokrovsk sector, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reported on Facebook on June 10.
“Su-25 aircraft, one tank, an armored combat vehicle, a cannon and four vehicles were destroyed,” Ukrainian General Staff said.
Ukrainian Armed Forces repelled 19 enemy attacks.

title: Israel kills 3 Hezbollah members on Syria border : Lebanon army source
message:
BEIRUT (AFP): Israeli strikes targeting a convoy of tankers entering Lebanon from Syria late Monday killed three members of Hezbollah, a Lebanese military source and a war monitor said.
“Three Syrians working with Hezbollah and two Lebanese were killed in an Israeli strike targeting a convoy of tankers entering Lebanon on the border with Syria,” the monitor’s director Rami Abdel Rahman told AFP.
The Israeli army said it also carried out strikes in southern Lebanon overnight after one of its drones was shot down on Monday.
A few hours before the strikes, Hezbollah said it had downed an Israeli Hermes drone over Lebanon, the fifth of the type since February.
On the Israeli side of the border, at least 15 soldiers and 11 civilians have been killed, according to the army.
event_breakdown: Israeli strikes targeting a convoy of tankers entering Lebanon from Syria late Monday killed three members of Hezbollah, a Lebanese military source said a war monitor said.The Israeli army said it also carried out strikes in southern Lebanon overnight after one of its drones was shot down on Monday.Hezbollah said it had downed an Israeli Hermes drone over Lebanon, the fifth of the type since February .

message:

No sirens were triggered by the incident.
It appears the Haifa alert was a Hezbollah kamikaze drone.

title: Eight 13th - century catapult shots found at Kenilworth Castle
message:
Catapult shots from 13th Century found at castleEnglish Heritage said the shots were fired in a siege of Kenilworth Castle in 1266English Heritage said the discovery was made during a project to improve accessibility around Kenilworth Castle.
English Heritage said the shots would have been fired during the siege of Kenilworth Castle in 1266, one of the longest sieges in English history when the country was in the grip of civil war.
Eight 13th Century catapult shots have been discovered "perfectly preserved" outside the walls of a castle in Warwickshire.
For a total of 172 days between 25 June and 13 December 1266, Kenilworth Castle was under constant attack in one of the most significant military contests of Henry III’s reign.
After almost six months, the resistance efforts of the rebels fell to starvation and disease, and surrendered Kenilworth Castle to Henry, who then gave it to his son, Edmund, Earl of Lancaster.
event_breakdown: English Heritage said that experts don't know when the catapult were fired, but they could have been fired during a siege of Kenilworth Castle in 1266. Eight catapult shots were found in the moat under the castle walls and are the earliest examples of medieval siege weapons ever found in the UK.

Cornell College said the four instructors had been teaching "as part of a partnership with a university in China".

title: US lifts weapons ban on controversial Ukrainian military unit
message:
The move will help the Azov Brigade, among Ukraine’s most effective and popular fighting units, move beyond its reputation as a far-right movement.
The US has removed restrictions on the transfer of American weapons and training to a high-profile Ukrainian military unit with a chequered past.
The State Department applied the Leahy vetting process to the Azov Brigade, which has been absorbed into Ukraine’s National Guard as the 12th Special Forces Brigade.
The State Department found “no evidence of Gross Violations of Human Rights (GVHR) committed by the 12th Brigade Azov,” according to a statement.
“This is a new page in our unit’s history,” the Azov Brigade wrote in a statement on Instagram.
event_breakdown:
Azov Brigade, a high-profile Ukrainian military unit with a chequered past, was cleared by the United States for weapons training and aid.

“The State Department determined on April 19 that Azov no longer meets the criteria for designation,” a spokesperson said. 

Azov originally opened fire on the Donbass republics of Donetsk and Luhansk in 2014. It was formed with ultra-nationalist and neo-Nazi components, including representing in its initial emblem. Last year the emblem was modified to remove the Nazi symbols. 

“This is a new page in our unit’s history,” Azov said a statement on social media, thanking foreign supporters.

title: 81 Combat Engagements In Frontline , AFU Destroy Russian Su - 25 In Pokrovske Sector

title: South Korean troops fired warning shots after brief border incursion from North
message:
SEOUL, South Korea — South Korean soldiers fired warning shots after North Korean troops briefly violated the tense border earlier this week, South Korea's military said Tuesday, as the rivals are embroiled in Cold War-style campaigns like balloon launches and propaganda broadcasts.
Those North Korean soldiers carrying construction tools — some of them armed — immediately returned to their territory after South Korea’s military fired warning shots and issued warning broadcasts, the Joint Chiefs of Staff said.
But South Korean media reports said that about 20-30 North Korean soldiers had entered South Korean territory about 50 meters (165 feet) after they likely lost their way.
The reports said most of the North Korean soldiers were carrying pickaxes and other construction tools.
South Korea said North Korea has installed its own border loudspeakers in response but hasn’t turned them on yet.

title: South Korean troops fired warning shots after North Korean soldiers briefly crossed land border
message:
By HYUNG-JIN KIMAssociated PressSEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korean soldiers fired warning shots after North Korean troops briefly violated the tense border earlier this week, South Korea’s military said Tuesday, as the rivals are embroiled in Cold War-style campaigns like balloon launches and propaganda broadcasts.
Those North Korean soldiers carrying construction tools — some of them armed — immediately returned to their territory after South Korea’s military fired warning shots and issued warning broadcasts, the Joint Chiefs of Staff said.
But South Korean media reports said that about 20-30 North Korean soldiers had entered South Korean territory about 50 meters (165 feet) after they likely lost their way.
The reports said most of the North Korean soldiers were carrying pickaxes and other construction tools.
South Korea said North Korea has installed its own border loudspeakers in response but hasn’t turned them on yet.
event_breakdown: The Associated Press reports at least 20-30 North Korean soldiers crossed the tense border separating North and South Korea on Tuesday near Paju, a city just south of the demilitarized zone. The North Korean soldiers reportedly crossed into South Korean territory and were eventually forced back after South Korean soldiers fired warning shots. Such incidents are rare, however it's particularly tense following a recent balloon launch and other cold war-style propaganda efforts carried out by the Koreas.

North Korea fired an unidentified projectile toward the sea off its east coast on Tuesday, South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said.
South Korea's military said it detected an "unidentified projectile" launched Tuesday morning from an area near the North Korean capital Pyongyang.
The Japanese Coast Guard said the North Korean projectile appeared to have landed outside the country's exclusive economic zone, The Associated Press reported.
The United States Indo-Pacific Command issued a statement saying that the launch highlighted the "destabilising impact of (North Korea's) illicit weapons program," Reuters reported. It also said Washington's commitment to the defense of South Korea and Japan "remains ironclad."
North Korea said Monday that dialogue with the United States is "out of the question" and threatened to "counter the U.S." if it persists with recent "hostile" policies, AP reported.
This announcement came days after North Korea accused the Biden administration of hostility and warned that U.S.-North Korean nuclear diplomacy is headed toward a dangerous situation.
The United Nations said on Friday that North Korea was pressing on with its nuclear weapons program and several countries urged tougher international sanctions following its missile and nuclear tests.

title: South Korean troops fired warning shots after North Korean soldiers briefly crossed land border
message:
SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korean soldiers fired warning shots after North Korean troops briefly violated the tense border earlier this week, South Korea's military said Tuesday, as the rivals are embroiled in Cold War-style campaigns like balloon launches and propaganda broadcasts.
Those North Korean soldiers carrying construction tools — some of them armed — immediately returned to their territory after South Korea’s military fired warning shots and issued warning broadcasts, the Joint Chiefs of Staff said.
But South Korean media reports said that about 20-30 North Korean soldiers had entered South Korean territory about 50 meters (165 feet) after they likely lost their way.
The reports said most of the North Korean soldiers were carrying pickaxes and other construction tools.
South Korea said North Korea has installed its own border loudspeakers in response but hasn’t turned them on yet.

title: 3 killed , 5 wounded in Israeli airstrike in eastern Lebanon - Xinhua
message:
BEIRUT, June 11 (Xinhua) -- Three people were killed, and five others were injured on Tuesday in an Israeli airstrike that targeted a convoy of tankers transporting diesel in eastern Lebanon, Lebanese military sources told Xinhua.
The sources, who spoke anonymously, said that an Israeli warplane fired four air-to-surface missiles at an unspecified convoy of tankers that was transporting diesel from Syria to Lebanon.
They continued that the missiles completely burned the tanks, killing three people and wounding five others.
Meanwhile, Hezbollah said its fighters fired a surface-to-air missile on Tuesday at dawn at an Israeli plane that violated Lebanese airspace and also attacked Israeli sites using several missiles.
Israel then retaliated by firing heavy artillery toward southeastern Lebanon.
event_breakdown:
1. Three people were killed, and five others were injured on Tuesday in an Israeli airstrike that targeted a convoy of tankers transporting diesel in eastern Lebanon, Lebanese military sources said.
2. The source spoke anonymously, saying that an Israeli warplane fired four air-to-surface missiles at an unspecified convoy of tankers that was transporting diesel from Syria to Lebanon.
3. The missiles completely burned the tanks, killing three people and wounding five others.

title: Interceptor missile from Syria lands on Akkar house
message:
An interceptor missile fired from Syria landed overnight on an under-construction house in the Akkar town of Fnaydeq, lightly wounding a child and causing material damage, the National News Agency said.
The Syrian air defense missile was fired during a deadly Israeli airstrike that targeted a Hezbollah convoy and a building in the Hermel border town of Hawsh al-Sayyed Ali.

title: Kharkiv mayor says striking Russia has helped to calm embattled city
message:
Ukraine's army has struck missile launch positions in Russia, helping to reduce the number of attacks on the embattled city of Kharkiv, its mayor told Reuters on Tuesday.
While missile and drone strikes continue, Ihor Terekhov said the change had helped bring relative "calm".
Also read | Russian strikes on Ukrainian city of Kharkiv kill at least two, injure manyTerekhov is visiting a conference in Germany which aims to encourage European support and investment in Ukraine.
The mayor said that about 11,500 people had arrived in Kharkiv city from regions that were being actively bombarded.
Russia launched three guided bombs at Kharkiv on Monday, damaging at least two houses, according to local officials, underlining the continuing threat.
event_breakdown: Ukraine's army has struck missile launch positions in Russia, helping to reduce the number of attacks on the embattled city of Kharkiv, its mayor told Reuters on Tuesday.

title: China Increases Its Missile Forces While Opposing U . S . Missile Defense
message:
China has opposed U.S. missile defense plans since the Reagan Administration's Strategic Defense Initiative and has continued its criticism in recent years.
RESPONSEChina's growing missile forces, its willingness to threaten Taiwan, and its barrage of threats against American missile defense plans all require a firm response from Washington.
Cost of Weakness By refusing for most of his Administration to support aggressive development of missile defense, and by his long-standing support of the 1972 Anti-Ballistic Missile Treaty that would limit the effectiveness of missile defenses, President Bill Clinton has helped to undermine Asian confidence in missile defense.
Administration officials should use every opportunity to stress that U.S. National Missile Defense and Theater Missile Defense programs are non-nuclear and defensive.
This is necessary to strengthen Asian confidence in U.S. missile defense technology over ballistic missile or nuclear weapon alternatives.
event_breakdown:
China's growing missile forces, its willingness to threaten Taiwan, and its barrage of threats against American missile defense plans all require a firm response from Washington.

title: Suspect arrested in stabbing of 4 instructors from Iowa college in China
message:
HONG KONG — A suspect has been arrested in the stabbing of four US college instructors in a public park in the northeastern Chinese city of Jilin, police said Tuesday.
The educators from Cornell College, a private liberal arts college in Mount Vernon, Iowa, were wounded “in a serious incident” on Monday, while participating in a partnership program with Beihua University in the city of Jilin, in northeastern China, according to the college.
Iowa state representative Adam Zabner told CNN his brother, David Zabner, was one of the victims of the stabbing.
The Chinese leader noted his own enduring ties to the state of Iowa in his announcement.
Last year, six people were killed and one injured in an early morning stabbing incident outside a kindergarten in southern Guangdong province.
event_breakdown:
The governor of Iowa, Kim Reynolds, said in a statement that she was “shocked to hear of the violent attack against four US college instructors in Jilin, China. The safety and security of our residents and visitors is our top priority, and we offer our support to the victims and their families.”
New York State Governor Kathy Hochul, who was visiting the city, also said she is praying for the victims and said the attack on Cornell individuals is unacceptable.
In the news texts, six people were killed and one injured in an early morning stabbing incident outside a kindergarten in southern Guangdong province.

title: Russia attacks residential area in Kostiantynivka in Donetsk Oblast , injuring 6
message:
Russian troops carried out an airstrike on the town of Kostiantynivka in Donetsk Oblast overnight on June 10, injuring at least six people, Donbas Realii news outlet reported on June 11, citing the police.
Russia dropped a KAB-500 aerial bomb on the town's residential area at around 11 p.m. local time, causing a fire in a five-story building, according to Ukraine's State Emergency Service.
The attack damaged 16 high-rise buildings, two administrative buildings, and two infrastructure facilities, the State Emergency Service said.
Moscow's troops attacked settlements in Donetsk Oblast 15 times over the past day, Governor Vadym Filashkin said.
Two people were also reportedly injured in the town of Pokrovsk.

Non-strategic nuclear weapons, also known as tactical nuclear weapons, are designed for use on the battlefield.

message:
Beirut/Tel Aviv, June 11 : The Hezbollah movement has fired dozens of Katyusha rockets at targets in northern Israel.
The Israeli military confirmed on Tuesday that it had recorded about 50 missiles fired from Lebanon.
The Israeli attack on an area at the border with Syria left five killed, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reported.

Since the war in the Gaza Strip began eight months ago, there have been daily military confrontations between the Israeli army and the Hezbollah militia and other groups in the border area between Israel and Lebanon.

title: China : Four US college instructors stabbed in public park
message:
Police in China have arrested a 55-year-old man after four US university tutors were stabbed by an assailant at a public park in a rare attack on foreigners.
The Iowa Cornell College instructors are in hospital after a “serious incident” during a daytime visit to the park in the northern province of Jilin, a college statement said.
Iowa Representative Adam Zabner said his brother, David, was one of the four instructors injured in the incident, which he described as a stabbing.
He said his brother had been stabbed in the arm at Beishan Park in Jilin city and was recovering in hospital.
Cornell College said the four instructors had been teaching “as part of a partnership with a university in China”.

title: Pakistani army kills 11 militants in raid in the northwest following bombing that killed 7 soldiers | World News
message:
Pakistani security forces raided a militant hideout, killing 11 in an overnight operation in a former stronghold of the Pakistani Taliban in the restive northwest, authorities said on Tuesday.
The intelligence-based raid was in retaliation to Sunday's roadside bombing that killed seven soldiers in the same Lakki Marwat district in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, bordering Afghanistan, the military said in a statement.
No one has claimed Sunday's attack, however, blame is likely to fall on Pakistani Taliban, known as Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan or TTP, an ally of the Afghan Taliban but is a separate group.
Pakistani officials often accuse Afghanistan's Taliban rulers of giving shelter to TTP fighters, a charge that Kabul repeatedly denies.
Pakistani Taliban says it is not using Afghan soil for attacks in Pakistan.
event_breakdown: Pakistani security forces raided a militant hideout, killing 11 in an overnight operation in a former stronghold of the Pakistani Taliban in the restive northwest, authorities said on Tuesday. The raid on Tuesday was conducted in the restive northwest.

title: Mysterious sonic booms rattle the SoCal coast , and officials say expect more from SpaceX
message:
Mysterious sonic booms rattle SoCal coast, and more are coming: 'My dog freaks out'As seen from Huntington Beach, a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket with 22 Starlink satellites launches in March.
Space Force officials previously claimed such incidents were rare, and that sonic booms from rocket launches and landings had little effect on the coast.
For some residents, the sonic booms and the increasing number of rocket blasts have had an effect on their lives.
Although the blast of the rockets might be audible only in neighborhoods close to Vandenberg, sonic booms can have a wider reach.
That hasn't been the experience of Patricia Jacob, who has felt the sonic booms in recent months from her home in Moorpark.

"My dog freaks out in the house right now," Bowles said, adding that the blast of the rockets also caused her windows to rattle.

On the Israeli side of the border, at least 15 soldiers and 11 civilians have been killed, according to the army.

title: South Korean troops fired warning shots after brief border incursion from North
message:
SEOUL, South Korea — South Korean soldiers fired warning shots after North Korean troops briefly violated the tense border earlier this week, South Korea's military said Tuesday, as the rivals are embroiled in Cold War-style campaigns like balloon launches and propaganda broadcasts.
Those North Korean soldiers carrying construction tools — some of them armed — immediately returned to their territory after South Korea’s military fired warning shots and issued warning broadcasts, the Joint Chiefs of Staff said.
But South Korean media reports said that about 20-30 North Korean soldiers had entered South Korean territory about 50 meters (165 feet) after they likely lost their way.
The reports said most of the North Korean soldiers were carrying pickaxes and other construction tools.
South Korea said North Korea has installed its own border loudspeakers in response but hasn’t turned them on yet.

North Korean soldiers likely crossed about 50 meters into South Korean territory, according to reports. North Korean border loudspeakers have been installed but have not been activated, South Korea has stated.

title: The  Duped  Sri Lankans Fighting in Russia Ukraine War
message:
With no communication for months, and reports of at least 16 Sri Lankans killed and 37 wounded, distraught families are pleading with politicians for help.
AdvertisementThe government says around a dozen Sri Lankans are being held prisoners of war in Ukraine, after being lured there in pursuit of work.
Colombo has remained neutral in the Ukraine war, but reports that Russian authorities supported the recruitment of ex-soldiers from Sri Lanka have sparked tensions.
"If Sri Lankans are in a dangerous situation, it's the duty of the government... to ensure that they are safely returned," Balasuriya said.
- 'Duped' -At least 22 Sri Lankans who joined Russian forces have managed to desert, escape and return home, defence officials said.
event_breakdown:
Events:
Ukrainian authorities report that 16 Sri Lankans have been killed and 37 wounded in the ongoing war in Ukraine.

title: South Korean troops fired warning shots after brief border incursion from North
message:
SEOUL, South Korea — South Korean soldiers fired warning shots after North Korean troops briefly violated the tense border earlier this week, South Korea's military said Tuesday, as the rivals are embroiled in Cold War-style campaigns like balloon launches and propaganda broadcasts.
Those North Korean soldiers carrying construction tools — some of them armed — immediately returned to their territory after South Korea’s military fired warning shots and issued warning broadcasts, the Joint Chiefs of Staff said.
But South Korean media reports said that about 20-30 North Korean soldiers had entered South Korean territory about 50 meters (165 feet) after they likely lost their way.
The reports said most of the North Korean soldiers were carrying pickaxes and other construction tools.
South Korea said North Korea has installed its own border loudspeakers in response but hasn’t turned them on yet.

message:

The reports said most North Korean soldiers carried pickaxes and other construction tools.
